title: Voting Advice Application settings
description: Settings for an OpenVAA-built voting advice application.

admin.description: Settings related to the administrative functions.

email.description: The admin email of the application. When errors occur, users may be asked to contact this address.

appVersion.description: Settings related to the version of the app and handling of saved user data.

version.description: The current version of the app.

requireUserDataVersion.description: If the app version in which user data is last saved is smaller than this, the data will be reset.

source.description: The url of the source code for the app.

colors.description: The main DaisyUI colors used by the application. These have to be defined separately for both the light (default) and dark themes. Only some of the named colors are used in the application: e.g., 'warning' is also used for 'error'.

^primary|secondary|accent|neutral|base-1.description: The color value as a hex string or an rgb string

font.description: The main font used in the application. Fallback sans-serif and emoji fonts will be added automatically.

name.description: The name of the font. Be sure to escape any spaces or enclose the name in quotes. You must also supply the url property.

url.description: The download url of the font. This will be added to the <link> tag in the <head> section of the HTML.

style.description: The style of the font, i.e. 'sans' (the default) or 'serif', which will decide the fallback fonts to use.

supportedLocales.description: A list of the locales supported by the application.

code.description: The ISO 639 locale code, e.g, 'en' or 'es-CO'.

name.description: The name of the language in the language itself, e.g. 'English' for locale 'en' or 'Suomi' for locale 'fi'.

isDefault.description: Whether the language is the default language for the application. Only mark one language as the default language for the application.

analytics.description: Settings related to data collection and other research or analytics use.

platform.description: Which platform, if any, to use for analytics. Remember to also check that the translations under the `privacy` key and the platform used are up to date.

name.description: The name of the analytics platform.

code.description: The tracking code or similar id for the platform.

infoUrl.description: The url for more information about the tracking platform.

trackEvents.description: Whether to collect anonymous usage data about all UI actions, including answers to statements. This will only have an effect if the analytics platform is defined.

entityDetails.description: Settings related to the entity details view, i.e. the pages for individual candidates and parties.

candidate.description: The content tabs to show for candidates.

party.description: The content tabs to show for parties.

showMissingElectionSymbol.description: Whether to show a marker for missing election symbol in entity details, e.g. 'Election Symbol: --', or hide missing items completely. The marker, if shown, is defined in the translations.

showMissingAnswers.description: Whether to show a marker for missing answers in entity details as, e.g. 'Age: --', or hide missing items completely. The marker, if shown, is defined in the translations. This only applies to non-opinion questions.

header.description: Settings related to the app header.

showFeedback.description: Whether to show the feedback icon by default in the header.

showHelp.description: Whether to show the help icon by default in the header.

matching.description: Settings related to the matching algorithm.

minimumAnswers.description: The minimum number of voter answers needed before matching results are available.

partyMatching.description: The method with which parties are matched. • None: no party matching is done • answersOnly: matching is only performed on the parties explicit answers • Mean/Median: missing party answers are replaced with the mean, median or mode of the party's candidates' answers. Nb. Mode is not yet implemented because of difficulty of handling multiple modes when the counts are tied.

questions.description: Settings related to the question view.

showCategoryTags.description: Whether to show the category tag along the question text.

showIntroPage.description: Whether to show the questions intro page before going to questions.

showResultsLink.description: Whether to the link to results in the header when answering questions if enough answers are provided.

results.description: Settings related to the results view.

cardContents.description: Settings related to the contents of the entity cards in the results list and entity details.

candidate.description: The additional contents of candidate cards. NB. the order of the items has currently no effect.

anyOf.description: The scores for question categories. If there's only one category, submatches are never computed. Applies to both the results list and entity details.
Show the entity's answer to a specific question. Only applies to the results list.

hideLabel.description: Whether to hide the question label in the card.

format.description: How to format the answer. • Default: use the same format as in EntityDetails. • Tag: format the answers as a pill or tag.

party.description: The additional contents of party cards. NB. the order of the items has currently no effect.

anyOf.description: The scores for question categories. If there's only one category, submatches are never computed. Applies to both the results list and entity details.
List party's the top 3 candidates within it's card. Only applies to the results list.
Show the entity's answer to a specific question. Only applies to the results list.

hideLabel.description: Whether to hide the question label in the card.

format.description: How to format the answer. • Default: use the same format as in EntityDetails. • Tag: format the answers as a pill or tag.

sections.description: Which entity types to show in the results view. There must be at least one.
